item.title: [PI] Two Questions [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mariokillu Mariokillu
item.description:
@Mariokillu wrote:

RealmofTerror:

That’s not necessarily Vain’s fault considering he just gave you a basic code based on no information about the base your using. On the topic of making it so owners don’t lose items when they die, just add onto the death method. For example on some sources it’s youDied() so look around for that.

Never said it was his fault.

Umm… the information about the base is in the title. [size=12pt][PI] Two Questions [PI][/size]

PI as in Project Insanity

I’ll take another look at the death method, thanks

item.title: [PI] Two Questions [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mariokillu Mariokillu
item.description:
@Mariokillu wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:1, topic:372088”] if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("trade") { if (!inWild()) { c.getPA().movePlayer(2604, 4775, 0); c.sendMessage("Welcome to trade!"); } else { c.sendMessage("You cannot do this while in the wilderness."); } } [/quote]

Thanks Vain

Does anyone know how to do the Owners don’t drop stuff thing?

EDIT:

When I put your command in, it gave me an error.

You had it as

(!inWild())

When it should be

(!c.inWild())

But still, thanks

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Two Questions [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mariokillu Mariokillu
item.description:
@Mariokillu wrote:

Question #1:

How do I make it so when Owners (player right 3) die, they don’t lose their items?

Atm, it has it so Admins can’t drop items… so I searched for the code that makes admins not drop items.

I toyed around with this code but no luck.

Question #2:

How do I edit this command so it doesn’t allow you to use it in the wild?

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("trade") { c.getPA().movePlayer(2604, 4775, 0); c.sendMessage("Welcome to trade!"); }

Thanks

Read full topic
